channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Suave Italian Banker Who Wants to Be the Jamie Dimon of Europe
item.description: Andrea Orcel has teed up UniCredit for a potential takeover of rival Commerzbank. He wants to build something Europe lacks—a banking champion.

item.title: ‘I don’t want to be unfair’: My mother gave me $150,000 to buy a house. One sibling wants 15% ownership. What now?
item.description: “I do not want to be unfair to my siblings, but I also do not want them to own an interest in my house.”

item.title: Wall Street Turns Skittish on Eve of Rate Cuts
item.description: Bond investors are suddenly bracing for a downturn, while equity investors appear more sanguine.

item.title: ‘My mom still has his original will’: A few months before he died, my father went online and made a secret will, cutting off my mother. Can he do this?
item.description: “His new will leaves his estate to my two nieces, nephew, my sister and me.”

item.title: Rich Americans Prep Fail-Safe Estate Plans Ahead of Election
item.description: With the presidential race in a dead heat, wealthy Americans are calling estate lawyers.

item.title: Should you share your pension payout with your spouse, even if it means less money?
item.description: Retiree couples often have to make a choice about whether to add survivor benefits to a pension, which reduces their monthly checks.

item.title: The Fanatic Amateur Investors Behind Palantir
item.description: Neither a consumer brand nor a meme stock, Palantir Technologies has developed a fervid following among amateur investors—and it is joining the S&P 50...

item.title: Retire out West? No, thanks. Wildfires kill 10,000 seniors prematurely every year.
item.description: Add that to the reasons I’m not retiring to California, where the Bridge Fire has burned more than 51,000 acres.

item.title: Google's Breakup Is Starting to Get Priced In
item.description: Valuation has fallen as analysts are less optimistic that dual antitrust cases will leave the company unscathed.

item.title: My husband, 75, is not eligible for Social Security. How is this possible? Is he entitled to my spousal benefits?
